## Summary results for /home/visual/contracts/3.OpenSCV/openscv-subfolders-mythril/7-3-1a-Bug/7-3-1a-Bug.sol
### Integer Arithmetic Bugs
- SWC ID: 101 in Contract `transaction_malleablity`
- Function name: `ecrecoverFromSig(bytes32,bytes)`
In file: /home/visual/contracts/3.OpenSCV/openscv-subfolders-mythril/7-3-1a-Bug/7-3-1a-Bug.sol:67
```
function ecrecoverFromSig(bytes32 hash, bytes sig)
      public
      pure
    returns (address recoveredAddress)
    {
        bytes32 r;
        bytes32 s;
        uint8 v;
        if (sig.length != 65) return address(0);
        assembly {
            r := mload(add(sig, 32))
            s := mload(add(sig, 64))
            v := byte(0, mload(add(sig, 96)))
        }
        if (v < 27) {
          v += 27;
        }
        if (v != 27 && v != 28) return address(0);
        return ecrecover(hash, v, r, s);
    }
```

# Analysis results for /home/visual/contracts/3.OpenSCV/openscv-subfolders-mythril/7-3-1a-Bug/7-3-1a-Bug.sol

## Integer Arithmetic Bugs
- SWC ID: 101
- Severity: High
- Contract: transaction_malleablity
- Function name: `ecrecoverFromSig(bytes32,bytes)`
- PC address: 786
- Estimated Gas Usage: 645 - 3701

#### Description

The arithmetic operator can overflow.
It is possible to cause an integer overflow or underflow in the arithmetic operation.
In file: /home/visual/contracts/3.OpenSCV/openscv-subfolders-mythril/7-3-1a-Bug/7-3-1a-Bug.sol:67

#### Code

```
function ecrecoverFromSig(bytes32 hash, bytes sig)
      public
      pure
    returns (address recoveredAddress)
    {
        bytes32 r;
        bytes32 s;
        uint8 v;
        if (sig.length != 65) return address(0);
        assembly {
            r := mload(add(sig, 32))
            s := mload(add(sig, 64))
            v := byte(0, mload(add(sig, 96)))
        }
        if (v < 27) {
          v += 27;
        }
        if (v != 27 && v != 28) return address(0);
        return ecrecover(hash, v, r, s);
    }
```

#### Initial State:

Account: [CREATOR], balance: 0x0, nonce:0, storage:{}
Account: [ATTACKER], balance: 0x0, nonce:0, storage:{}

#### Transaction Sequence

- Severity: High

- Function name: `ecrecoverFromSig(bytes32,bytes)`
- PC address: 792
- Estimated Gas Usage: 809 - 4144

#### Description

The arithmetic operator can overflow.
It is possible to cause an integer overflow or underflow in the arithmetic operation.
In file: /home/visual/contracts/3.OpenSCV/openscv-subfolders-mythril/7-3-1a-Bug/7-3-1a-Bug.sol:67

#### Code

```
function ecrecoverFromSig(bytes32 hash, bytes sig)
      public
      pure
    returns (address recoveredAddress)
    {
        bytes32 r;
        bytes32 s;
        uint8 v;
        if (sig.length != 65) return address(0);
        assembly {
            r := mload(add(sig, 32))
            s := mload(add(sig, 64))
            v := byte(0, mload(add(sig, 96)))
        }
        if (v < 27) {
          v += 27;
        }
        if (v != 27 && v != 28) return address(0);
        return ecrecover(hash, v, r, s);
    }
```
